name: Green Curry with Shrimp and Pineapple
ingredients: 2 tbsp green curry paste (store-bought or homemade)
1 tbsp fish sauce (or soy sauce for vegetarian option)
instructions: Heat the vegetable oil in a large pot or Dutch oven over medium heat.
Add the green curry paste and cook, stirring constantly, for 1-2 minutes until fragrant.
Add the shrimp and cook until pink and cooked through, about 2-3 minutes. Remove the shrimp and set aside.
Pour in the coconut milk and chicken/vegetable broth. Bring to a simmer.
Stir in the fish sauce/soy sauce and palm sugar/brown sugar until dissolved.
Add the pineapple chunks, red bell pepper, and green peas. Simmer for 5-7 minutes, or until the vegetables are tender.
Return the cooked shrimp to the pot.
Stir in the kaffir lime leaves and Thai basil. Simmer for another minute.
Taste and adjust seasoning as needed. Add more fish sauce/soy sauce for saltiness or palm sugar/brown sugar for sweetness.
Serve hot with cooked jasmine rice.
